title: [NEW] Having issues Patching 5.17? Click Here!
body:
Hey everyone!

As we all ice down our fingers and get some wrist exercises in from the Party IP weekend, we need to be prepared for the next patch!  We know some of you may have issues that crop up during the patching process, and we want to make sure you can get back onto the Rift ASAP.  Take some time to check out the steps below, which should resolve most issues.

-----------------------------------------

> ***Launcher/Patcher never pops up, or disappears after you press "LAUNCH"***

This can be caused by corruption with the patcher itself or it failed to properly self-patch. Additionally, it may be due to some issues with the configuration of your computer system's permissions (meaning it can't properly save the files in the correct location). To resolve this, make sure to complete all the steps in our [Patching Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues)!


> ***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. Many of the most common Anti-virus programs [have already whitelisted LoL](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3), however make sure to update yours to the latest version!

Also, even though you may have set specific exceptions in place before for your security program, League of Legends has gone through a major update. Therefore, your security program may recognize the old version of League of Legends, but not the new version. 

To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

--------------------------------------------------------------

*If after completing these steps, and you still do not see the glorious orange 'LAUNCH' button, feel free to drop us a post in this thread!  Rioters as well as Wrenchmen volunteers will be on hand to respond and provide some additional help!*

This is happening to me as well.  Same exact message.  I however am at 33% and I am able to scan about 200 files before I get the error.  The highest my scanned files were (during calculating differences) was around 670 (which was a solo outlier).  I have errorred every single attempt.  I have restarted my computer.  I have closed down all anti virus software despite the fact I have never had to before.  I have never encountered this issue with LoL in my five years of playing.  I'm unsure what is the cause of this problem.  My only guess is that is it somehow related to the new servers or some type of bug.  Do you have any advice based upon my situation?

Thanks.

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases{highest version number}

go there and check if this file "S_OK" exists and if it doesn't make a file(with no extension), rename it("S_OK") and put it in the folder then restart the client. If it already does exist then you are on your own.

Having the exact same issue

Hey Riot,

I've had an issue with the game for the last 10 or so patches. This issue only occurs after a patch.
This is the issue;

- The lolpatcher patches itself fine and the sfx "ping!" sound plays when patching is succesfully done.
- When the launch button is pressed the login screen does not come up.
- After spamming the button, nothing happens.
- The EULA comes up once sometimes.
- After a random period of time (timing the periods for the last few months it ranged from 23 minutes to several hours) a second EULA comes up, I press accept and the login screen comes on.

**HOW DO I FIX THIS?**

I have tried;
- **All **the support page guides including everything suggested on this page;
  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues
  **Repatching did not work.**
  
  Optimising my connectivity using: 
  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues
  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions

- A complete re-install using the guide;
  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends
  Including deleting all files associated with riot games, deleting all registry values and keys associated with riot games and running a full wipe using ccleaner of my computer.

- Using any guides posted by redditors on this issue.

None of these methods did anything to fix the issue and I still had to spam click the "LAUNCH" button to open the login screen if it opened at all.

Attached is my dxdiag and r3d files.

**PLEASE HELP**

~Desperate Summoner

i just recently uninstalled league cause the patch went through last night but it was buggy it made me dodge games and kept closing in and out and this is just this morning on how far it got

If you let the patcher sit there at "applying patches" for an extended period of time (for several hours for example), does it eventually complete?  Or does it stay there indefinitely?

If it never moves forward, and gets stuck on "Apply Patches", there might be a problem with your Windows Permissions.  Essentially, the patcher is trying to override files on your installation, but something is stopping it from doing so.  Make sure to complete all of the steps in our [Permissions Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions), which should help get this resolved.

Let us know!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=KeLE28AL,comment-id=000500000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-04T00:05:30.531+0000)
>
> If you let the patcher sit there at "applying patches" for an extended period of time (for several hours for example), does it eventually complete?  Or does it stay there indefinitely?
> 
> If it never moves forward, and gets stuck on "Apply Patches", there might be a problem with your Windows Permissions.  Essentially, the patcher is trying to override files on your installation, but something is stopping it from doing so.  Make sure to complete all of the steps in our [Permissions Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions), which should help get this resolved.
> 
> Let us know!

So to let you know it loaded after i let it repair all yesterday and its running but it keeps disconnecting me and the client open and closes and sometimes it will make me dodge! help!

If you are getting disconnected consistently, this strongly indicates that there is some type of connection issue going on here.  You are able to make a connection to our PvP.net Servers, but it isn't stable or consistent, causing you to DC.  Because of this, make sure that you try completing all of the steps in our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!  The steps there are common solutions which should stop these issues.

Let us know if it still isn't working!

I have patched just fine 2 days ago and been playing normally until today when i dc'd mid game, when i tried to restart my league i got hit with the 33% calculating differences situation. I figured i'll just let it take its course but after waiting for around 30 mins reaching to about 10k+ and with no sign of it ending. I started looking around for possible fixes, nothing really worked for me so i started to messing around with the LoL folders and i ended up getting it to work again ._. and i figured it may help some people as well, though i'm not entirely sure if it'll work for everybody. (PS. sorry if this didn't help you)

1) Right click on LoL icon/ Open file location/RADS/projects okay when you get into Projects there should be "Lol_air_client" and "LoL_air_config_na". There should also be "Lol_game_client and "LoL_game_client_en_us". 
Delete the folders "lol_air_client" and "lol_game_client" but DO NOT delete "lol_are_client_config_na" and "lol_game_client_en_us".

2) After you deleted the following folders in step 1. Open "lol_air_client_config_na" -> releases -> and find the highest number. For me it was (0.0.0.55) it may be the same for you.. i'm not sure but after you do so, open it. Once you open it you should see a file titled "S_OK".

3) Copy "S_OK" and back out onto "releases".  Find that highest number as you did in step 2 and paste "S_OK" behind it. So for example, mine was "0.0.0.55" so after you paste it, it should look like "0.0.0.55S_OK" 

4) After you've done the following, run League of Legends on Administrator. You should no longer be stuck on 33% but back at 0% :D and it'll patch back up from there . Oh btw, when you hit 33% it is going to go back to calculating differences BUT this time it should only go back up to about 80~100 before passing through and finishing the patch. 

Again, sorry if this doesn't work out for you as i just fiddled around with the files a bit and it somehow managed to work for me. If it does fix your problem then awesome! good luck!
